column4: Can someone help me mount my slave drive? It's ext partitioned, just did a fresh install of Feisty
Can someone help me mount my slave drive? It's ext partitioned, just did a fresh install of Feisty
SDA
try "sudo mkdir /mounted" then "sudo mount /dev/sdb1 /mounted"
idk what your slave shows as in /dev, but guessing since it's the second disk
the one i said would mount then first partition of the second-recognized disk
mount: special device /dev/sdb1 does not exist
ok that means we have to figure out what your hard drive is being called
can you do "ls /dev" and see whats there
oh you figured out what device it is?
ok then
i have a question
yeah?
where is it mounted?
it's probably root-owned
sudo chown -R <yourusername>|<yourusername> <mountpoint>
you said it's mounted.  what folder is it mounted at?
mountpoint just means wherever you put it when you mounted it
if you click it and give it your password it opens up the drive right?  click the < arrow on the top left (right above where it shows what's in the drive), then click the little pencil
/media/disk
cd /media
then ls -l
those are both lowercase L's
i have to log off because i'm dist upgrading, but if that doesnt do it, then also do "sudo chmod -R 774 /media/disk"
